timeline.message:
add /beacon/committees endpoint to allow committeeAssignments to be returned.

added missing test to show no content for /beacon/state

Updated readme which was missing a link to the spec.

Signed-off-by: Paul Harris <paul.harris@consensys.net>

#1197

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                  description = "Request a list of the Committee assignments for a given epoch.",
          
          
            
                  description = "Request a list of the committee assignments for a given epoch.",
timeline.author: macfarla
macfarla

replies.bodyText: will people reading this know what committee indices are?
replies.author: macfarla

replies.bodyText: Committee indices is the correct term from the spec.  A committee assignment is the set of committee indices in the committee.
replies.author: ajsutton

replies.bodyText: so should i leave this comment as-is? or change the 'get the committees' to 'get the committee assignments'?
replies.author: rolfyone

replies.bodyText: It's probably fine as-is but suspect Get the committee assignments for a given epoch is all that's actually required and probably the most accurate.  @benjaminion ?
replies.author: ajsutton

timeline.author: mark-terry

timeline.bodyText: When is this null?  If the store is null?
timeline.author: mark-terry

timeline.bodyText: You can just use thenApply here and not need to wrap in a completedFuture.
timeline.author: ajsutton

timeline.bodyText:
Committees are always calculated for one epoch ahead.  So if you want to calculate committees for epoch you need to get the state for epoch - 1.  The exception is epoch 0 which uses genesisState (as does epoch 1).
So you are actually able to calculate committees up to one epoch ahead of the current one.
timeline.author: ajsutton

replies.bodyText: ok i've done that and now i think our testing may be inadequate as no tests broke, suggesting that there's too much mocking to see this pretty significant change.
replies.author: rolfyone

replies.bodyText: names are hard. still don't love it
replies.author: macfarla

replies.bodyText: also I don't get why we need to get committees at epoch - 1. Is it self-explanatory or do we need to make it clear?
replies.author: macfarla
